utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is %uh tour guide one, Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Ha~ Hi, good~ Hi, good morning.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um this is participant one, how are you?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you feeling great this morning?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about you? Are you doing great?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How about you? Are you doing great?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is there %um anything that I can help you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm actually %uh planning %um a trip %uh to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I was wondering if you could actually help me out, Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And so I didn't get your name just now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh D R E L I N.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh and my last name is %uh Barcelon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'll just call you Edrelin?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you were saying that you wanted to come to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe can I have a little bit more details like %uh when will you be coming?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And like who will you be coming with?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm actually planning to visit %uh on August.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh and I'm planning to take with me my husband and my son.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how old is your son?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh my son is actually turning ten.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm %uh- we're planning to go to Singapore on his birthday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's actually his birthday, August twenty sixth.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um- yah, so I'm planning to take him there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: A sort of like a birthday gift.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's a very nice birthday gift.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how many days will you be %uh spending in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh actually it would be just for a one day stopover.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um I'm- what I want is to %uh seek advice from you like how we can %um actually maximise that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And is this your first time to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And has any of your friends or relatives came to Singapore before?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, I've had a couple of %uh friends or officemates who actually, you know, who've been to Singapore before.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I haven't gotten really much %um information from them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you will be arriving at Singapore on the twenty fifth, I guess?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that you can spend twenty sixth of August here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh yah, that would be great.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %um you will be taking a flight in %uh do you also need me to like advise you how do you get from the airport

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and I presume you'll be staying in a hotel as well?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That will be great since it's my first time so, you know, I need directions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and you will probably leave Singapore on the twenty seventh?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so %uh what are your son like any theme park or what is he like?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What I'm planning to do is actually to take him to %um

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: that would be my sort of %um gift to him.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your husband, does he like %uh

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: what kind of food does he like then?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um me and my husband actually, that's really our main %uh goal why we want to go to Singapore is really %um to really try out the food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think any- %uh we really want to try out like maybe the signature %um dishes in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like, you know, it's like if you've been to Singapore, you have to really taste this or eat this.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If- is that the signature dish of Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because %uh a lot of people likes to eat this food including the local people as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and of course %uh pepper crabs as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so I think we- the locals here generally, if we have friends coming over- we like to introduce them to these %uh dishes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I actually want to try out because %uh I've watched in the television like Asian Food Network over here that there are a lot of %um- I think they call it the hawker %um-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, maybe you could also, you know, give us an idea on you know, where we should go to, you know, have a try on that place?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- alright, maybe I can do a recommendation now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um okay, if like if you arrived in the airport we have three terminals at the moment.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um so you probably arrive let's say terminal one, Changi Airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's located on the eastern part of SIngapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will be checking in to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's say if you are putting up in the Orchard Road hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is like about thirty minutes' drive by taxi to the Orchard Road hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are quite a number of hotels there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again it depends on your budget.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that's very convenient because we have the subway train station out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As well as the %uh buses and it is also the main shopping belt.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so I was thinking also maybe %uh since you have only one day in Singapore

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you could also try taking the subway %uh to your hotel which we call it the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh yah, I've heard about that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you can do is once you arrived in the airport, you can go to the subway train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you look for the direction that says %uh city train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you go down %uh to the train station and you can buy %uh a tourist card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or- okay, since it's only one day, I think what you can do is you just buy a standard card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on this train, it's actually %uh East-West Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is %um from the East, you'll be travelling down to City Hall MRT train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think maybe the easiest since you only have one day

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would recommend that you stay in the %uh City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are two hotels there for you to choose.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um may I have a- do you have an idea, Lynnette, like how much does it cost in that hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's about in the region of Singapore Dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I only actually have one thousand-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um let's say that %um given my budget, so maybe I have to %um have more money for- but if it would be me, my husband and my son, that would be considered as a package tour, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you can actually just come in, take the subway to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you can do a one way tour and I will do a few recommendation for you %uh so you don't have to spend that much money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So let's say it's %uh the three of us and then I only have one thousand dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So let's %um so if we do with the hotel which cost you said three hundred dollars, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the three hundred dollars is already good for the three of us if like we stay in one room?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then we'll %uh- I think we'll just go ahead and take the subway then because I think that's much cheaper if %uh compared to riding a taxi, correct?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the taxi ride from the airport to the Orchard Road will probably cost you about- again depending on the timing that you have arrive, %uh in the region of let's say forty dollars- Singapore Dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So all the prices I'm quoting you will be in Singapore Dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So MRT, you mentioned that I just have to buy a standard card.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay. And how much does the standard card %um cost?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay. And how much does the standard card %um cost?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It depends on which %uh particular location that you are going to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so let's say we will have to choose.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's say now maybe I'll just talk to you first before I show you the map, the city map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The MRT ride ranges from about two dollars %uh to- let's say three dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But because if you are buying a standard card, there is actually a dollar deposit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's say if the taxi- the MRT cost one dollar for example, then you will have to put two dollars into the machine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I will suggest that when you are- let's say your husband is trying to get- %uh retrieve the bags %uh at the conveyor belt.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there are also money changer inside %uh the airport area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe one can take care of the bags.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the other person will go and change some money first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just %uh change a little bit of money just for your meals in the hotel % uh in the hawker centres.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As well as for the ride to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Maybe you can change about Singapore Dollars, two hundred dollars first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh or anything more but I think this is just for my recommendation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just some money to get by for the short while.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can always change money in the hotel with the hotel cashier.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or if you're going to stay in near any of the shopping centres %uh there's always a money changer in the shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can always change your money there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you are spending let's say money in the %uh shopping centre %uh or buying tickets to Universal Studio, you can always pay them with credit cards.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think the most %uh advisable time for us to arrive is really in the morning, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that we could have all afternoon and stay there up until %um the night?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I mean if you are going to- because it's a short flight from Philippines, so you can arrive in the morning on Saturday %uh on the twenty sixth %uh and then you stay overnight the next day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or of course if you can have a bit more time, you can arrive prior to twenty sixth, twenty fifth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you leave on the twenty seventh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh %hm yah I think I'll go with the twenty fifth and then will have, you know %um twenty sixth.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then, yah, leave on the twenty seventh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will have like a two night stay in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so from the hotel, okay, so %um you mentioned that it's only thirty minutes %uh from the hotel to get to- I mean from the airport to get to the hotel, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, from- if you're taking the subway-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh because this is a East-West Line %um you will have to change %uh the line in City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so I think better that you reserve forty five minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so of course to be very detailed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh always check with the information counter at the MRT train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We call our subway the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are like certain hotels you can stay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe the Landmark Hotel over at the- near to the Bugis Area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um this is- do we- do you- would you consider this %uh as more of a like a child friendly or a family %uh friendly type of a hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You know given that I have a kid with me.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is just a normal kind of a hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so they do have %uh quite a lot of family staying in this hotel as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I don't think you will require like any special %uh items for the- for your child, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the whole day you'll be out.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um let's say %uh if we arrived already at the hotel

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um from there, we can already like maybe go to Universal Studios.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: because again, you can take the subway.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you do is- okay, let's say we skip the arrival part, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are quite %uh you know what's going on from your airport, you take the subway-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh so let's say we start on the twenty sixth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, on the twenty sixth itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh of course if you want to have the hotel breakfast, you can always- because most of the time, breakfast will be included in your hotel package.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you decide not to do it, not to take the hotel breakfast.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would suggest that you come out from the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is a little %uh coffee shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I've been to India before so %um yah, I actually- I like it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you can do is you just go across the road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are small cafes just across your road- the road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh there is quite a famous I would say %uh Roti Prata store.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %uh what they serve is like pancake-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they have another dish called murtabak.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It has all kind of fillings in there; chicken-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a dough, they pan fry it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can eat it with your hands just like the locals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You tear out into small pieces and you dip them in curry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But of course if you don't want, you can always use the spo~ and- oh fork and spoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can have that for breakfast, it's quite a filling dish.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe I'll suggest that %uh a one piece, it depends on what kind of meat you order.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It ranges from five dollars- Singapore Dollars onwards.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can order just two pieces to try or maybe you can try that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can also %uh do a bee hoon goreng.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you just order a small- %uh two dish is fine for 3 person.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the serving is actually %um quite big.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can also have %uh one of our tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like a teh tarik kind of a tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Tea with milk and they pull the tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have a lot of foam on your tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is- this is something very local as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so you can have that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you just walk towards the subway %uh which will be the Bugis MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you take the subway %uh to the HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um well Singapore, I think majority %uh of the people there %uh are already English %um speakers, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if we ask for direction %um or or, you know, instructions or something like that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we would be able to %uh communicate with them okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh majority of us here speaks English %uh because English is our first language and all our sign are all in English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if there's any %uh problem, you need directions, please feel free to approach anybody that looks like a local.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: 'Cause I don't, you know, I'm- we might have a difficult time, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's good that %uh we will be able- the majority of the people %uh can speak English so- alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so it's not a real issue.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, the MRT again %uh I would suggest that %uh you take a map of the MRT so that you have a better idea how to travel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because again %uh from your hotel to the %uh- to HarbourFront where you're going to- I would say that I think you'll just do Universal Studio on Sentosa on the twenty sixth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will have to change your MRT ride over at Dhoby Ghaut because that will be the %uh North East Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think the detailed part, I think we should- you should be able to work it out, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if I go to the MRT and then I just have to tell- %uh I just would have to identify on which %uh station, is that what you call it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: On which station I- we should be %um going?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay no. All our MRT, we have this map out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me try and get you the %uh MRT map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are a few lines Okay, from the airport is the East to the West line in Jurong.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then we have the North to the South line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have another line, the North East Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right now these are %uh the lines that's available.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So once you get down to the MRT, %uh you will be able to see %uh the map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I have opened up the %uh MRT lines for you to see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Would you be able- do you- were you- are you able to copy that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh I'm not able to see it on my %um screen yet.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think %uh you have to share that with me for me to able to see it on my screen over here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the East side?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %hm, no. I'm not seeing anything yet on my screen over here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh would you be able- nothing at all?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Changi side is on the East.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see it now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the green line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see on the right-hand side?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It says number three Changi Airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is actually the East West Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So can you follow towards your left-hand side?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you- yah, the green line go to the left.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you will see City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: City Hall, let me check that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you will see Bedok, Kembangan all the rest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you will come to Bugis.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh there, I see it now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can stay in this hotel called Landmark.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or alternatively, there is another hotel which is very convenient, just Lavender.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called a new- V %uh victory.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can stay there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- I think these two locations are pretty convenient.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At least, you know, you don't have to change lines.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well from the airport, yes, all the way and V Hotel is just directly next to the Lavender Hotel- %uh MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So once you come out- yah, once you come out the hotel, it's there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I think that's much- a much better option-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just outside your hotel, there are lots of eating places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can get a breakfast for %uh there's a food court.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A food court is an air-conditioned %uh it's a modern version of the non air-conditioned hawker centres.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can choose like if you want %uh just drinks, you want Chinese food, you want fried noodles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do that for your breakfast and then you carry on your tour to Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So let's say we're done with breakfast.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it also along with the green lines?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, then so- okay, you will have to change your train at %uh City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and after that you will have to change to the red line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see City Hall?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you see Dhoby Ghaut?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Dhoby, there, yes, I saw it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and from there, you change to the purple line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that also in the red one or the- oh the purple line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You'll see Clarke Quay, Chinatown and-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will alight at HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think I will not confuse you with telling you all the cost of the MRT ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What you do is when you get down at the MRT, you just- you know, there will be machine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just press like which direction- which station you are going to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and the machine will tell you how much to pay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you are taking the subway, please remember to take a small Singapore money with you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like a five dollars kind of and a two dollars and some coins.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is change given but they accept the smaller notes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from HarbourFront %uh you can take the cable car-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um do we have to pay for that as well?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The cable car ride %uh I will suggest that you take like %uh one way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then once you're in Sentosa-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and also please remember to pack a change of clothes and also like maybe swimming gear as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because if you have time, you can go swimming in our beautiful lagoon on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and in case, you know, your son play some of the games, he may get wet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think- yah, please bring a change of clothes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you do is like if you are going early in the morning I suggest you go to a short while to the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: On Sentosa itself, you can go on the %uh- okay, I'll close this %uh MRT %uh map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then I will show you the Sentosa map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can get by using the buses on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and the buses that operates on Sentosa were- %uh they are free.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, they are already included in your fare.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So Sentosa is actually %um because I'm seeing your screen right now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's an island just about one kilometre away from the mainland.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's on the southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think now you can see the map, the whole map now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see something blinking in the top left corner?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and you see %uh tall tower and then there's something down that has a little bit of U.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see my arrow?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you can take the cable car, alright, across.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's see how you- we, you know, oh after you-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think, yah, that's a nice ride here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and on Sentosa, you see all these roads?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can travel on the buses- Sentosa buses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and they are colour coded as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh again you just look at where you are going to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would suggest that you go to the lagoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see Siloso Beach?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do the beach out here for early morning swim.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can go to Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So Universal Studios is actually within Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's actually over this side.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and of course it's like a theme park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can see %uh you know, you can basically spend like three quarter of a day or almost a day-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh in the park and %uh you can do a lot of attractions there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um so the ticket, we have to buy it on the place itself?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can also buy %uh online before you arrive.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we can buy it online as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And do you have an idea how much would the ticket cost?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh a day pass for the adult will cost Singapore Dollars, sixty six dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and a child will be forty eight dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But just to check again, let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The date twenty sixth August, is that a weekday or weekend?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there's a- yah, there's a difference in the price when- if it's a weekday or a weekend.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So like at weekend, it will be at seventy two dollars for the adult and a child will be fifty two dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But that's- but it's much- but the price is %uh a bit higher.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just a few dollars difference.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do %uh- %uh there are quite a few shows there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are few shows that you can do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there's a Madagascar, there is this %uh the ride in the movie, Transformer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think your son will like that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: My son and my husband are actually fans of Transformers.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm sure they will like that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is a nice %uh ride to do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and of course, there are other shows and- I think I will suggest that lunch, you just have a meal in Universal Studio itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because, you know, it takes time to come out and then go in again.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'll just- I will suggest that lunch, you have it in Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they have like fast food available.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so maybe just a quick lunch like a sandwich or something.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Depending on how much %uh your son would like to stay in there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How much time he wants to spend there, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So because the %uh Universal Studio opening hours, it's from ten A.M. to seven P.M.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So maybe, you know, we could stay there for like- %um I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe five to, you know, six hours.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could spend like let's say from ten o'clock, you know, if you go early in the morning for your swim.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or even if you don't want to swim, just take a walk in the bea- %uh in- around the beach area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you just take a Sentosa bus to the Universal Studio or you can also take the %uh what do you call that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh those are all included so you don't have to pay extra money.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh then you go to Universal Studio spend let's say from ten or ten thirty onwards right up to about five thirty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you go for your dinner with the chili crabs.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So from there, you- again you can take the subway to the Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there are quite a few restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you can have your chili crabs out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um what about for %uh you know, shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh because I think one %um Singapore is also %um popular with- when it comes to- because you know, we're about to go home already, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because we're done with dinner and we have- before we leave, so we have to shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um I know that Singapore is very popular when it comes to gadgets.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um because I've heard from my friends that you can actually buy like gadgets in Singapore %uh for a much cheaper price.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also the quality is really good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um do you know for a place wherein, you know, my husband because he's a techy person,

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: my husband can go and maybe, you know, check for cell phones, laptop or iPad, something like that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, you can go to this place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh again if you're going to stay in the Lavender MRT area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's just like two station away from where you are.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they have all the gadgets out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe if you- before you come, you know, you can always check on the prices first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh because there are so many shops out there that sells similar items, so they are pretty- %uh I would say very attractive prices.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's like a one %uh stop shop for like different gadgets.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there's also competition going on between %um the sellers there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so what you- maybe they may not be able to give you like a lot of discount.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but they can always give you freebies because they know that if you go into the shop and you walked out you'll probably end up buying from someone else.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's quite reputable, the shops there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I will recommend like this location So you can do your shopping out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And let's say your- you can leave your husband there for yourself- oh yourself or- I'm sorry, your husband and your son if your son is interested in a technical product.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then what you do is you walk over to City Hall MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you do your shopping out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our shops are open until nine thirty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you're just ten minutes away from one another.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we can actually separate from each other and I can do my own shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um here you have like clothes %uh you know, shoes, bags, all those stuff.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have- %uh in the Raffles Place- %uh sorry, Raffles City because it's just above the City Hall MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they have from the branded, alright, like the Gucci and everything else.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right up to the midrange products.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's %uh about three three levels of shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And also we have an underground shopping area %uh called CityLink.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they have all- yes, they have all your shoes, your clothes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Toiletries, cosmetics, everything is in there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um is it like %um somewhat similar to %um Hong Kong or you could say that it's actually much cheaper?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's different because the quality here %uh is better, I would say.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's not like the street kind of %uh shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the quality is good I would say.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's say if you are buying the branded product, I think here in Singapore, we are still relatively affordable.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and %uh if you are buying the midrange products %uh they are in %uh I would say a good condition.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And on top of that, you can always claim back the GST, the Goods and Services Tax.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Which is like %uh seven per cent.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's so easy, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You- once you arrived back in the airport when you are leaving Singapore you just produce the receipt that has been stamped %Uh sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is given by the retailer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And let's say if you are putting your purchases in your luggage, so you have that checked by %uh officials before you check in your bags.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you are buying smaller items like %uh jewellery, watches then you can have your %uh GST refund %um just before you board the plane.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Once you cleared the immigration, you look out for this sign that says GST and you can claim back your money immediately if you like.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you can even charge that back to your card and they will mail back the %uh refund to you when you're back in the Philippines.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so I think for one day, you may not have that much time %uh to do your shopping but %uh- so I suggest like let's say you come out from Sentosa about five thirty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you can even %uh let's say to save time, you can even spe- have your dinner in VivoCity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because when you're at Universal Studio, you take the Sentosa train out you're already at VivoCity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you do is when you're finished with Sentosa let's say I suggest about five thirty, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you just take the Sentosa train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will be out in this big shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are lots of %restaurants out there- and you can-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So this is like a mall?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you don't want to get out of this place, you can also do your shopping out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and %uh- but since your husband wants to do the tech product so I think I would suggest that you have your dinner there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then proceed to %uh Funan Centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or alternatively you can do this in the morning %uh before you go on to Sentosa island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- yah, because the shops will open like %uh ten thirty in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can- for Funan %uh about ten thirty, eleven.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can go from %uh Funan.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So allocate let's say about one hour-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you go on to Sentosa, let's say at about %uh in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you can do your lunch again if you are doing Funan you can go down to the hawker centre in the basement area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's- thank you for giving me a lot of %uh options.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I hope you have an idea now how to plan.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I saw a while ago %uh while we were in that Sentosa park %um that there was also something mentioned there about like spas.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um so %uh like within Sentosa, there are also places where I can- like maybe get a massage or, you know, something like that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is a spa there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so while your kids are enjoying and your husband enjoying their time in Universal you can go for your spa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's also- is that outside Universal or within Universal?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or alternatively if your husband is doing his shopping down in Funan you can always get your spa done %uh at the %uh nearby %uh hotel area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are some spas there as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sorry 'cause I'm, you know, I'm %um budget conscious.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And the price range %uh could you give me an idea on that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: just the full body or just %uh the legs?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, maybe like a full body massage.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like, you know, from like thirty minutes to an hour of that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, approximately about a hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %um- okay I think tentatively that's what I can suggest since it's like a one day programme.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so I hope you got an idea now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So thank you for giving me a lot of options.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What about in terms of giving like tips?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um how- what's your %um suggestion on that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay %uh in Singapore we don't really practice %uh giving of tips but of course if you're very happy with the service %uh you're welcome to do so.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But otherwise we %uh don't have a compulsory tipping but if you're in the- %uh if you're having your meals in the restaurants, they do have a service charge there already.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's not really %um a requirement to give, you know, tips and all that.
